title: Brandfort√¶lling ¬∑ Lindhardt og Ringhof Uddannelse Design System
content:
OVERVIEW
Brandfort√¶lling

Velkommen til Alineas design guide. I det f√∏lgende gennemg√•r vi Alineas visuelle identitet og dets grund elementer samt viser eksempler p√• brugen til inspiration.

Alinea




For at samle Alineas mange initiativer og synligg√∏re Alinea p√• tv√¶rs af platforme, produkter og ydelser, er der udviklet en visuel identitet baseret p√• Alineas vision og karaktertr√¶k. 

Karatertr√¶kkene er omsat til design drivers, der er mere visuelle udgaver af karatertr√¶kkene og skal virke guidende for arbejdet med designet. 

Design driverne er en tjekliste for det visuelle udtryk, som den visuelle identitet skal leve op til.¬†

1 + 1 = 3

I skolen l√¶rer vi systematisk, at kombinere en r√¶kke kendte former streger, cirkler og prikker til bogstaver. 

Bogstaverne bliver med tiden til ord, der bliver til s√¶tninger, der s√¶tter os istand til at lave kompleks formidling. 

Vi oplever igennem denne l√¶ring, at bestandelene er blevet til mere end blot summen af dem. 

Det giver os helt nye muligheder, der s√¶tter os istand til at takle fremtiden. 

Vi oplever, at 1 + 1 kan blive til 3.

title: Introduktion til Lindhardt og Ringhof Uddannelse ¬∑ Lindhardt og Ringhof Uddannelse Design System
content:
OVERVIEW
Introduktion til Lindhardt og Ringhof Uddannelse

Lindhardt og Ringhof Uddannelse er et af Danmarks st√∏rste og f√∏rende l√¶ringshuse.

Om os

Vi udvikler l√¶remidler og l√¶ringsaktiviteter, som giver b√∏rn, unge og voksne de bedste muligheder for at forme deres fremtid gennem uddannelse. Som Danmarks f√∏rende l√¶ringshus er det vores m√•l at skabe l√∏sninger, der engagerer, motiverer og udvikler mennesker. Uanset, hvor de er i deres uddannelsesliv.




WHY

Hos Lindhardt og Ringhof Uddannelse tror vi p√• uddannelse som den vigtigste forandrende kraft i vores samfund.

Det er vores helt klare m√•l at bidrage til udviklingen af hele mennesker gennem uddannelse.

Det er derfor, vi er til, og derfor vi siger: Forandring gennem uddannelse.










	

I √∏jenh√∏jde

Vi g√∏r noget for nogen i kraft af de l√¶remidler og aktiviteter, vi udvikler og fornyer.¬†Vi er p√• forkant og sikrer, at de er virkelighedsn√¶re, anvendelses-orienterede og inspirerende.‚ÄØ

Det er vores m√•l altid at m√∏de elever, studerende og‚ÄØundervisere, der hvor de er ‚Äì og flytter de sig, s√•‚ÄØflytter vi med.

Internt som eksternt m√∏der vi hinanden med respekt,‚ÄØog hos os st√•r alle d√∏re √•bne. Vi er drevet af dialog,‚ÄØog det er vigtigt for os l√∏bende at m√∏de vores‚ÄØbrugere og lytte til deres meninger og behov.‚Äã¬†







	

Passionerede 

Vi tror p√•, at pr√¶station og passion g√•r h√•nd i h√•nd.‚Äã¬†

Vi br√¶nder for det, vi laver, og vil g√∏re en positiv‚ÄØforskel for b√∏rn, unge og voksne. Derfor skubber vi til‚ÄØverden, hver eneste dag, og skaber bev√¶gelser, der‚ÄØ√¶ndrer ved tingenes tilstand.‚ÄØ‚Äã

Vi str√¶ber efter det ypperste i udviklingen af‚ÄØl√¶remidler og aktiviteter ‚Äì og sammen √∏nsker vi at‚ÄØs√¶tte et aftryk p√• vores omverden.‚ÄØ‚Äã¬†

‚Äã¬†

Det er passionen, der driver os p√• vej.







	

Modige

Vi t√∏r handle p√• nye ideer og udfordrer status quo. Vi‚ÄØarbejder agilt og med √∏je for fremtiden.‚ÄØ‚Äã¬†

Det betyder, at vi griber og tager ejerskab p√• de‚ÄØmuligheder, der ligger i nye teknologier og formater.‚Äã¬†

‚Äã¬†Vi afpr√∏ver ting i vores dom√¶ne, som vi aldrig har‚ÄØpr√∏vet f√∏r, og vi skaber l√∏sninger, der kombinerer‚ÄØvores st√¶rke faglighed med kreativitet.‚ÄØ‚Äã¬†

Det er modet, som har gjort os til dem, vi er i dag - og‚ÄØdet er vores m√•l altid at v√¶re bedre i morgen, end vi‚ÄØvar i g√•r.







Forskellige stavem√•der identificeret

title: Introduktion til Forst√• ¬∑ Lindhardt og Ringhof Uddannelse Design System
content:
OVERVIEW
Introduktion til Forst√•

Forst√• er Danmarks f√∏rende forlag p√• samarbejder med eksterne partnere. Sammen udvikler vi undervisningsprodukter; undervisningsforl√∏b, kampagner, film og meget andet til grundskolen, ungdomsuddannelser, fagprofessionelle og frivillige.¬†




Morgendagens l√¶ring starter med l√¶ring

Vores mission er at g√∏re al l√¶ring s√• engagerende som overhovedet muligt. Sammen med jer vil vi spr√¶nge rammerne for traditionel l√¶ring. Vi ved, at virkelighed i undervisningen skaber motivation og nysgerrighed, og derfor √∏nsker vi at samarbejde med virkelige partnere som jer. 

Er jeres felt vigtigt for b√∏rn og unge? Og har I en vision om at udbrede al jeres viden og erfaring, s√• flest muligt f√•r mulighed for at drage nytte og l√¶re af og med jer? S√• kan vi f√• jeres hjertesager ud i skolerne, erhvervsuddannelserne, i gymnasiet og p√• de videreg√•ende uddannelser.¬†




Hovedpr√¶sentation - FORSTAÃä.DK (2).pdf

title: Modal Patterns ¬∑ Lindhardt og Ringhof Uddannelse Design System
content:
Modal Patterns

The basic modal is a simple modal with a short message.

The message can be just informative or highly important. From a simple information to a warning.

It might require a choice of the user, but doesn‚Äôt have to.

Find the categorisation of the Basic modal at the Variants section.

Anatomy




Heading

Body

Actions (Centred Button Group)

Close

Overlay

Variants
Info

Description

Used to present information or feedback that requires user awareness but no immediate action.

It doesn't include a dismissive action button (secondary CTA).







Confirmation

Description

Used when a user must explicitly confirm or cancel an action before proceeding. It presents a clear message about the consequences of the action.

Always Includes two buttons:

Primary CTA: Continue the action

Secondary CTA: Cancel the action







Form




Description

Contains a form element or multiple requiring. It supports validation and may include additional guidance to help users complete the form successfully.

Primary CTA: submit

Secondary CTA: cancel the action

On submit we will always make a request to the server.







Choice

Description

Provides users with two distinct options where each action leads to a different outcome.

Primary CTA: the action (expected to be) taken by most users.

Secondary CTA: the action (expected to be) taken by less users.







What is not a Basic modal

We are excluding modals with longer flow, basket behaviour, Assignment Previews (settings + tabs) and fullscreen modals from being part of 'Basic Modals'.

These types of modals have more specific usecases and underlaying patterns which we will not force into a basic modal. 

Examples of these types in Portals and Fessor could be:

Creating + assigning teams

MF basket

MF Assignment Previews

Portal Full screen modals (global teacher guides)




Dismissing Modal

Click Cancel secondary CTA

Click X in the top

Press Esc on a keyboard

Click anywhere on the backdrop(overlay)

Action Complete: Triggering an action if the action completes successfully, modal close automatically.

Feedback in actions with server transaction
CTA State

State

	

Primary Button

	

Secondary Button




Idle

	

Enabled, default styling

	

Enabled, default styling




Submitting

	

Disabled (functionality only) 

	

Disabled (functionality + styling) 




Success

	

Keeps Disabled (functionality only) 

	

Keeps Disabled (functionality + styling) 

Animated icons

While pending state show spinner, we must set a minimum of time in case the request is super fast, to avoid a flickering effect.

After success request show checkmark for 3 seconds




Dismissing Modal blocked:

When the server request has started the user can not dismiss the modal.

Errors

If error while transition:

Modal keeps open

Buttons come back to the state before triggering the action

Error message between the body and the button group (Each Product Team decide the design for the error message)

Scrolling

The content between the Button group and the close button scrolls, so the Button group and the close button are always visible for the user




Content Guidelines

CTA Label Format for Form, Choice and Confirmation variations <Action verb> <context noun>

<Action verb>

Imperative

First word first letter should be capital

Action verb from a list:

Primary

	

Secondary




Afslut

Bekr√¶ft

Gem

G√• til

Log ind

Opret

Slet

Start

	

Annuller

Kasser

Luk

Opret (when choice modal)

<context noun>

First word first letter shouldn‚Äôt be capital

Optional




CTA for Info should be always:

Primary CTA

With label: Ok

Relation CTA & Heading

[Showing examples like in the proposal Suggestions Copy CTA Modals ] 




Icons

For widespread and basic actions like e.g. ‚Äúsave‚Äù and ‚Äúdelete‚Äù, where a global icon standard is established, an icon is put to the left of the label copy in the primary CTA.

For our youngest users and those with cognitive challenges, it can be very helpful to support the CTA with an icon. If the technical setup allows it and there is differentiation between primary school users and the rest, an icon may optionally be included in the CTA.

An icon CAN be applied even though there is no global icon standard established. It is not a must and should only be done if we can diffenciate between usertypes (eg. primaryscool vs. older students/teachers). Examples of this MUST be part of the UI documentation in the specific product and the designteam needs to showcase the split. 

Accessibility

Scroll lock: While the modal is open, it prevents background content from scrolling. This ensures that users stay focused on the modal content and are not distracted by the page behind it.

Focus lock: All keyboard focus is trapped within the modal when it‚Äôs open. Users cannot tab outside of the modal‚Äôs content. After the modal closes, focus automatically returns to whichever element was last focused before the modal opened.

Keyboard: Press Esc to close the modal

Aria properties: add aria-modal="true" , to indicate the presence of a "modal" element to users of assistive technology, meaning navigation is limited to the area itself and the background (the ancestors and siblings of the modal) is hidden.

Inert: Add Inert attribute on everything but the modal inert - HTML: HyperText Markup Language | MDN

How to: Powerpoint template

Powerpoint¬†templaten til LRU er opdateret med nyt logo, ny font, nye farver og ny toolbox, som du kan lade dig inspirere af. Den indeholder ogs√• en kort brugerguide p√• de to f√∏rste sider.¬†

Templaten skal bruges til pr√¶sentationer, som vedr√∏rer Lindhardt og Ringhof Uddannelse og af kompetencecentrene.¬†

Templaten er "skubbet" ud via IT til alle, som har en mail med @lruddannelse.dk, og du finder den f√∏rste gang ved at f√∏lge nedenst√•ende instrukser. Herefter skulle den meget gerne blive en fast del af dit¬†powerpoint.¬†

Tryk p√•¬†üìå¬†for at fastg√∏re den

title: Introduktion til Alinea ¬∑ Lindhardt og Ringhof Uddannelse Design System
content:
OVERVIEW
Introduktion til Alinea

Danmarks bedste og mest varierede udvalg af l√¶remidler

Alinea er Danmarks st√∏rste forlag inden for l√¶remidler til den danske grundskole.

Hvert √•r udvikler vi flere hundrede b√•de trykte og digitale l√¶remidler sammen med de allerdygtigste skoleforskere og praktikere i Danmark. Med vores l√¶remidler er vi med til at sikre eleverne fra 0. til 10. klasse en faglig, relevant og varieret skolehverdag, hvor hver enkelt elev f√•r de allerbedste betingelser for at udvikle sig godt b√•de fagligt og menneskeligt.¬†

Alinea er en del af Lindhardt og Ringhof Uddannelse ‚Äì et af Danmarks st√∏rste og f√∏rende l√¶ringshuse, der ogs√• rummer Akademisk Forlag, Lindhardt og Ringhof Uddannelse+ samt delejerskab af Praxis, GoTutor (herunder Learny) og Ordblindetr√¶ning.¬†

Lindhardt og Ringhof Uddannelse er en del af Egmont, som er Danmarks st√∏rste mediekoncern. Egmont har fortalt historier i over 100 √•r, laver film i Oscarklasse og fort√¶ller historier gennem nyheder, b√∏ger og magasiner. Egmont er en dansk fond, som hvert √•r giver n√¶sten 100 millioner til b√∏rn og unge, der har det sv√¶rt.




Design Systemer til Alineas digitale produkter
Fagportal Design System

title: Typografi ¬∑ Lindhardt og Ringhof Uddannelse Design System
content:
STYLE
Typografi

Tilf√∏j Alinea font + skrivefonten. Eksempler p√• brug og evt do/don't

Alinea font
Alinea Display font
Skrivefont
Download assets

Fonten findes ogs√• i en to-farvet display udgave. 

Den fungerer som et identitetsskabende og illustrativt element. 

Displayfonten er en Colorfont. 

Colorfont er et font format, der giver mulighed for at definere bogstavernes farve p√• forh√•nd. 

Det betyder, at n√•r du v√¶lger skriften i fontmenuen og skriver med den, vil den allerede v√¶re farvet. 

Display fonten m√• aldrig bruges i sm√• st√∏rrelser, hvor l√¶sbarhed og funktionalitet er vigtigst.¬†




V√¶r opm√¶rksom

Display fonten eksisterer kun i RGB- farver. Husk derfor altid at √¶ndre farverne til CMYK f√∏r der sendes til tryk. 

Dette g√∏res ved ‚Äùoutline‚Äù fonten og √¶ndre RGB-farverne til Alineas CMYK-farver.¬†




Farver

Fonten findes i syv forskellige farver. 

Disse ligger som v√¶gte i fontmenuen p√• lige fod med Bold og Regular. 

Man kan bruge farverne p√• kryds og tv√¶rs af fagomr√•der, men det er vigtigt, at man er bevidst om farvem√¶ssige konventioner, r√∏d til dansk, bl√• til matematik, gr√∏n til naturfag osv., s√• man ikke st√•r tilbage med noget, der forvirrer modtageren.

title: Logo ¬∑ Lindhardt og Ringhof Uddannelse Design System
content:
STYLE
Logo
Generelt
Grafik
Download
Logo

Vores prim√¶re logo er det bl√•. I f√• tilf√¶lde bruges de andre logofarver, fx hvidt, lysebl√•t eller lyser√∏dt logo p√• m√∏rke baggrunde.

Eksempler p√• farvekombinationer
Respektafstand

Logoet b√∏r altid v√¶re i balance med de omgivne elementer. Andre grafiske elementer, ikoner eller tekst skal placeres¬†

i en respektafstand fra logoet. Denne afstand skal v√¶re mindst h√∏jden p√• F‚Äôet i Forst√•. Logoet b√∏r ikke gengives mindre end med en bredde p√• 95 px (33 mm).

Hvis logoet indg√•r sammen med andre logoer, b√∏r det st√∏rrelsesm√¶ssigt ikke dominere. Som udgangspunkt placeres Forst√•-logoet altid til sidst i kontekst med samarbejdspartneres logo

title: Hvem er vi? ¬∑ Lindhardt og Ringhof Uddannelse Design System
content:
OVERVIEW
Hvem er vi?

Vi er en strategisk samarbejdspartner for eksterne partnere ‚Äì og en del af et af de st√∏rste og f√∏rende l√¶ringshuse i Danmark. 

Derfor har vi erfaringen og kompetencerne til at engagere jeres m√•lgrupper b√•de i fokuseret og stor skala. 

Det g√∏r vi med netop jeres dagsorden, forandringsm√•l eller l√¶ringsm√•l.¬†




SKR√ÜDDERSYET 360 GRADERS L√òSNINGER¬†

Vi har et 360 graders perspektiv p√• produktet: udvikling, drift, udbredelse og forankring. Vi sparrer og r√•dgiver jer til den bedste l√∏sning ud fra jeres √∏nsker og m√•l.¬†




EKSPERTISE OG ERFARING¬†

Vi har stor erfaring med at udvikle l√¶ringsprodukter sammen med partnere. 

Vi bruger velafpr√∏vede digitale plat- forme og s√∏rger for, at produkterne ses og bruges i mange √•r.¬†




FORST√Ö.DK - Til grundskolen¬†

Vi st√•r bag Forst√•.dk, hvor vi tilbyder gratis forl√∏b og indhold til elever og l√¶rere i grundskolen. Alt p√• Forst√•.dk er gratis og frit tilg√¶ngeligt for alle. Alle forl√∏b og indhold er udviklet i samarbejde mellem Forst√• og organisationer, virksomheder og kulturinstitutioner.

Farve specs

WCAG 2.0 guidelines er kategoriseret i tre niveauer for at im√∏dekomme forskellige brugers behov og udfordringer. A (laveste niveau), AA (mellem) og AAA (h√∏jeste standard).

Vi vil gerne matche AA standard. Det betyder at vi p√• farvekontraster skal have min. 4.50. 

Eksempler p√• brug af farver i content

title: Tab patterns¬†‚ö†Ô∏è ¬∑ Lindhardt og Ringhof Uddannelse Design System
content:
Tab patterns¬†‚ö†Ô∏è

The Tab  allows users to select one option from a set of mutually exclusive set. It presents all available options inline and allows for a quick view change, helping to filter content categories.




This component is best suited for a larger sets of options that contain a lot of content. Tabs give the user an immediate overview of pre-categorised content, aiding findability and discoverability.

New tab




Anatomy

A tab fully consists of a collection of nodes. A minimum of 2 nodes are needed for the tab to be a valid component. There is no maximum amount of nodes but it is recommended to not have above ten (10) nodes inside a tab.

Nodes ‚Ü¥

Icon (optional)

Label

Counter (optional)

Content Guidelines

Node Label format should be by default <context noun>. The label remains the same, whether or not user selects it. 

If optional properties such as the icon and counter are used, they should be applied to all nodes within a tab for consistency. Possible exception can be applied if the first tab node is an overarching option, for example grouping all content. Then, the first node does not need to have an icon.

Accessibility

Press Right Arrow andLeft Arrowto navigate between tabs

The tabs will automatically be selected when using the keyboard, no need to confirm the choice

title: Megaswitch patterns¬†‚ö†Ô∏è ¬∑ Lindhardt og Ringhof Uddannelse Design System
content:
Megaswitch patterns¬†‚ö†Ô∏è
BETA

The Mega Switch (also known as a Segmented Control) allows users to select one option from a small, mutually exclusive set. It presents all available options inline and emphasizes quick comparison and switching without navigating away or opening a menu.




This component is best suited for mode switching or filtering where all options are equally important and immediately available.

Anatomy

Nodes

Wrapper

Variants

Description

Both variants are used to present equally important choices to the user.

Maximum amount of nodes inside a megaswitch is 3 (three)

The nodes can contain an optional icon

Content Guidelines

Label format for the the nodes can vary and consist of both a combination of  <Action verb> <context noun> or just the <context noun>.

It is important that the label on all nodes matches the selected format.

An optional icon can be added to the nodes but follows the same logic and has to be present on either all nodes or none.

Accessibility

In order to adhere to accessibility guidelines, the megaswitch should keep it's dimensions across various screen sizes and ignore the scaling of the spacing variables that is otherwise taking place in less interactive components and layouts.




Do‚Äôs and Don‚Äôts
‚úÖ Do

Use for fast, reversible choices

Use clear, concise labels

Keep all options equally weighted

Use for filtering or mode switching




‚ùå Don‚Äôt

Don‚Äôt use for navigation between pages

Don‚Äôt mix actions and states

Don‚Äôt use for multi-select scenarios

Don‚Äôt hide critical functionality behind it

title: Dropdown patterns ‚ö†Ô∏è ¬∑ Lindhardt og Ringhof Uddannelse Design System
content:
Dropdown patterns ‚ö†Ô∏è

A dropdown is an element that allows users to choose one or more options from a predefined list. It typically appears as a compact field that, when activated (e.g., by clicking), expands to reveal a list of choices user can select from. Dropdowns are versatile and particularly useful for saving space and filtering content.

Usecases
Saving Space

When you have a moderate to large number of options (typically 5 or more) and need to conserve screen real estate.



Presenting a List of Choices

Ideal for categories, filters, states, countries, date selections (e.g., month, year), or any scenario where users need to pick from a well-defined set of values.

Secondary Actions or Navigation

Sometimes used for "More options" menus or navigation lists that are not primary.

Filtering and Sorting

Common in data tables or search results to refine the displayed content.

Anatomy

Label

Chevron

Option Variants

When expanded (opened), the dropdowns reveal options. These options are available in different variants, based on whether the dropdown is fulfilling a function of filtering, triggering an action or navigating to a destination.

Single choice

The single choice dropdown consists of options that are mutually exclusive, in between which user can only choose one. Once the user selects one, it will be marked and its function (filtering, sorting, etc. ) will be applied to the affected content. The label of the selected option will then be reflected in the dropdown label. Single choice options can have the following optional properties:

counter to visualise how many items are categorised under each option

leading icon







Multiple choice

The multiple choice dropdown consists of options that can be mutually exclusive but can be combined to specify a narrower filtering. The user can any number of options from the dropdown, from none to all available options within the filter. The amount of selected options will be reflected next to the dropdown label (in front of it) and will be shown as a number inside parentheses. Multiple choice options can have the following optional properties:

counter to visualise how many items are categorised under each option

leading icon







Simple menu

The simple menu consists of options that are often triggers for specific functionality. This functionality is considered secondary (non-crucial) functionality that expands on the primary functionality of the product. In some cases, the simple menu dropdowns can reveal entrypoints to secondary destinations within the product. Simple menu options can have the following optional properties:

leading icon

Dismissing Dropdown

Click on the dropdown again once opened

Click outside the options when opened

Press Esc on a keyboard

Click anywhere on the backdrop(overlay)

Loading content

When waiting for the page content to load, the dropdowns should be in a disabled state to visualise they can not be used until the page content is fully loaded. started the user can not dismiss the modal.

Search

For multiple choice dropdowns with more than twelve (12) items inside, a search field should be added for better findability. The search field is added to the top of the list of options and filters live through the options as the user types their input. If no matches are found, the copy will clearly state so.

Scrolling

The list of options inside a dropdown can be very long but the view should be limited to a maximum of seven (7) items visible, with the rest under the fold. User can scroll down in the list to see rest of the options. We use standard browser scrollbar for the dropdown.
If the dropdown contains a search field, then the view consists of search field and six (6) options.

Content Guidelines

Dropdown Label Format should be by default <context noun>.
If selection is available and has been made, then:

Single choice dropdown - <selected option> 

Multiple choice dropdown - <(*)><context noun> 

*number of selected options

Option Label Format is more flexible as the options can contain titles of books,  name of functionality, filters. With option labels it is important that the options within a dropdown follow the same format.

Accessibility

Focus lock: All keyboard focus is trapped within the dropdown when it‚Äôs open. Users cannot tab outside of the modal‚Äôs content. After the dropdown closes, focus automatically returns to whichever element was last focused before the dropdown was opened.

Press Enter to open the dropdown / Alternatively press Down Arrow

Press Down Arrow and Up Arrowto navigate inside the dropdown list of options

Press Space to select or deselect an option inside the list

Keyboard: Press Esc to close the dropdown
